name: Commonwealth v. Edison Electric Light Company, Appellant
name_abbreviation: Commonwealth v. Edison Electric Light Co.

judges: Before Mitchell, Dean, Fell, Brown, Mestrezat and Potter, JJ.
parties: Commonwealth v. Edison Electric Light Company, Appellant.

opinions.text:
Opinion by
Mr. Justice Brown,
This case was argued with Commonwealth v. Brush Electric Light Company, ante, p. 249, and is controlled by it.
Judgment affirmed.
opinions.author: Mr. Justice Brown,

attorneys: M. F. Olmsted and A. 0. Stamm, for appellant.
John P. Flhin, attorney general, and Frederic W. Fleitz, deputy attorney general, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Commonwealth v. Edison Electric Light Company, Appellant.
Argued June 3, 1902.
Appeal, No. 29, May T., 1902, by defendant, from judgment of C. P. Dauphin Co., Commonwealth Docket, 1901, No. 281, on appeal from tax settlement, in case of Commonwealth v. Edison Electric Light Company.
Before Mitchell, Dean, Fell, Brown, Mestrezat and Potter, JJ.
Affirmed.
M. F. Olmsted and A. 0. Stamm, for appellant.
John P. Flhin, attorney general, and Frederic W. Fleitz, deputy attorney general, for appellee.
January 5, 1903 :
